name: Michael Dimenshtein
body:
### Welcome to Michael Dimenshtein (@miki2826) GitHub Pages.
I am a software engineer, well versed in the arts of JavaScript and Java.
Currently employed @LivePersonInc.

### Slides
- [Choose Your Channels](http://webyoda.github.io/choose-your-channels/) - Event Driven Architecture, how to apply it when working with Backbone.js or Angular.js, and how ChronosJS can help with it. A session I gave with @itkoren [@JSIL 2015](http://jsilconf.com/)

### Contributions
- [ChronosJS](http://livepersoninc.github.io/chronosjs/) - JS Channels (Events / Commands / Reqest-Response / Courier) Mechanism
- [batchelor](https://github.com/LivePersonInc/batchelor) - Proxy utility to bundle a batch of calls in one request
- [cacherjs](https://github.com/LivePersonInc/cacherjs) - JS TTL Cache Mechanism
- [circuit-breakerjs](https://github.com/LivePersonInc/circuit-breakerjs) - Javascript Implementation for Circuit Breaker (Port of Hystrix Circuit Breaker)
- [machineto](https://github.com/itkoren/machineto) - Minimal (neto) implementation of a finite state machine in javascript
- [ws-test-page](http://livepersoninc.github.io/ws-test-page/) - WebSocket Test Page

### Communications
You can catch me in the following social networks
- Twitter [@dimenshtein](https://twitter.com/dimenshtein)
- Facebook [@miki2826](https://www.facebook.com/miki2826)
- LinkedIn [Michael Dimenshtein](https://www.linkedin.com/pub/michael-dimenshtein/86/73a/b68)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
